content:
StatisticFormula Class

Definition

Calculates statistical formulas.

In this Article

public class StatisticFormula
Inheritance
System.Object
StatisticFormula

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Formulas can be loosely grouped into the following categories: distributions, including inverse distributions; tests; and basic statistical formulas. Each group has common characteristics with respect to their input and return values.

Methods

Anova(Double,String)

The Anova formula determines the existence or absence of a statistically significant difference between the mean values of two or more groups of data.

public System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AnovaResult Anova (double probability, string inputSeriesNames);
probability
Double

Alpha value. The acceptable input range is between 0 and 1.

inputSeriesNames
String

Names of two or more input series. Each series must exist in the series collection at the time of the method call, and have the same number of data points.

Returns
AnovaResult

An AnovaResult object.

BetaFunction(Double,Double)

The beta function calculates the beta function value.

public double BetaFunction (double m, double n);
m
Double

First value for the beta function.

n
Double

Second value for the beta function.

Returns
Double

Beta value.

Correlation(String,String)

The correlation formula shows the strength of the relationship that exists between two random variables.

public double Correlation (string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
Double

Correlation value between the two groups of data.

Remarks

The method throws an exception if the input series do not have the same number of data points.

Covariance(String,String)

The covariance formula measures the degree of dependence that may exist between two random variables.

public double Covariance (string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
Double

Covariance value between the two groups of data.

Remarks

The method throws an exception if the input series do not have the same number of data points.

FDistribution(Double,Int32,Int32)

The F distribution formula calculates the probability for the F-distribution.

public double FDistribution (double value, int firstDegreeOfFreedom, int secondDegreeOfFreedom);
value
Double

The F value for which you want the distribution.

firstDegreeOfFreedom
Int32

First degree of freedom.

secondDegreeOfFreedom
Int32

Second degree of freedom.

Returns
Double

Probability for the F distribution.

FTest(Double,String,String)

The F-test formula performs a two-sample F-test using F distribution, and is used to see if the samples have different variances.

public System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FTestResult FTest (double probability, string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
probability
Double

The alpha value. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
FTestResult

An FTestResult object.

Remarks

The method throws an exception if the input series do not have the same number of data points.

GammaFunction(Double)

The gamma function calculates the gamma value.

public double GammaFunction (double value);
value
Double

Value for which the gamma value is required.

Returns
Double

Gamma value.

InverseFDistribution(Double,Int32,Int32)

The inverse F distribution formula calculates the inverse of the F cumulative distribution.

public double InverseFDistribution (double probability, int firstDegreeOfFreedom, int secondDegreeOfFreedom);
probability
Double

Probability for the F distribution. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

firstDegreeOfFreedom
Int32

First degree of freedom.

secondDegreeOfFreedom
Int32

Second degree of freedom.

Returns
Double

F value for the F distribution.

InverseNormalDistribution(Double)

The inverse normal distribution formula calculates the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution. The distribution has a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of one.

public double InverseNormalDistribution (double probability);
probability
Double

Alpha value. The acceptable input range is between 0 and 1.

Returns
Double

Inverse of the normal distribution function.

InverseTDistribution(Double,Int32)

The inverse t-distribution formula calculates the t-value of the Student's t-distribution as a function of probability and degrees of freedom.

public double InverseTDistribution (double probability, int degreeOfFreedom);
probability
Double

Probability for the F distribution. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

degreeOfFreedom
Int32

Degree of freedom.

Returns
Double

Inverse of the t-distribution.

Mean(String)

The mean formula calculates the average, or mean, of data stored in a data series.

public double Mean (string inputSeriesName);
inputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the data for which the mean value is required.

Returns
Double

Mean value of all the data points in the given series.

Remarks

If named input series does not exist in the SeriesCollection at the time of the method call, an exception is thrown.

Median(String)

The median formula calculates the median of the data stored in a data series.

public double Median (string inputSeriesName);
inputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the data for which the median value is required.

Returns
Double

Median of all the data points in the given series.

Remarks

If the named input series does not exist in the SeriesCollection at the time of the method call, an exception is thrown.

NormalDistribution(Double)

The normal distribution formula calculates the value of the standard normal cumulative distribution. The distribution has a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1.

public double NormalDistribution (double zValue);
zValue
Double

Value for which the normal distribution is required.

Returns
Double

Value of the standard normal cumulative distribution.

TDistribution(Double,Int32,Boolean)

The t-distribution formula calculates the probability for the Student's t-distribution.

public double TDistribution (double value, int degreeOfFreedom, bool oneTail);
value
Double

t-value for which you want the distribution.

degreeOfFreedom
Int32

Degree of freedom

oneTail
Boolean

If set to true, one-tailed distribution is used. Otherwise, two-tailed distribution is used.

Returns
Double

t-distribution function probability.

TTestEqualVariances(Double,Double,String,String)

The t-test with equal variances formula performs a t-test using Student's t-distribution with equal variances.

public System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TTestResult TTestEqualVariances (double hypothesizedMeanDifference, double probability, string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
hypothesizedMeanDifference
Double

Hypothesized difference between the means of the data groups.

probability
Double

Alpha value. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
TTestResult

A TTestResult object.

TTestPaired(Double,Double,String,String)

The t-test paired formula performs a t-test using Student's t-distribution with paired samples. This is useful when there is an observed natural pairing in samples (for example, when a sample group is tested twice).

public System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TTestResult TTestPaired (double hypothesizedMeanDifference, double probability, string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
hypothesizedMeanDifference
Double

Hypothesized difference between the means of the data groups.

probability
Double

Alpha value. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
TTestResult

A TTestResult object.

TTestUnequalVariances(Double,Double,String,String)

The t-test with unequal variances formula performs a t-test using Student's t-distribution with unequal variances.

public System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TTestResult TTestUnequalVariances (double hypothesizedMeanDifference, double probability, string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
hypothesizedMeanDifference
Double

Hypothesized difference between the means of the data groups.

probability
Double

Alpha value. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
TTestResult

A TTestResult object.

Variance(String,Boolean)

The variance formula calculates the variance within a group of data.

public double Variance (string inputSeriesName, bool sampleVariance);
inputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the data for which the mean value is required.

sampleVariance
Boolean

Specify true if the data is a sample of a population; and false if the data is the entire population.

Returns
Double

Variance within the group of data.

ZTest(Double,Double,Double,Double,String,String)

The Z-test formula performs a Z-test using normal distribution.

public System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ZTestResult ZTest (double hypothesizedMeanDifference, double varianceFirstGroup, double varianceSecondGroup, double probability, string firstInputSeriesName, string secondInputSeriesName);
hypothesizedMeanDifference
Double

Hypothesized difference between the means of the data groups.

varianceFirstGroup
Double

Variance within the first group of data.

varianceSecondGroup
Double

Variance within the second group of data.

probability
Double

Alpha value. The acceptable range is between 0 and 1.

firstInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the first group's data.

secondInputSeriesName
String

Name of the stem.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series* object that stores the second group's data.

Returns
ZTestResult

A ZTestResult object.
